title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: We weren't pathetic and bourgeois. (I cringe as I write that word; only a student wanker uses it, but that's how I felt.) So Joanne and I climbed up the steps in silence, the round ornate pillars of the Dugald Stewart Monument towering above on our left. A youngish cunt in an auld gadge's bunnet passed us as we saw the big, phallic Nelson Monument loom ahead; it reminded me why we were ascending this hill.
